data: On a fine evening in the month of September, 1836, a man about thirty years of age was leaning on the parapet of that quay from which a spectator can look up the Seine from the Jardin des Plantes to Notre-Dame, and down, along the vast perspective of the river, to the Louvre.
September | Seine | Jardin des Plantes | Notre-Dame | Louvre
quay | Jardin des Plantes | Notre-Dame | Louvre
Balzac, Honoré de, 1799-1850; Wormeley, Katharine Prescott, 1830-1908 [Translator]
